complianceChecker.title: Betriebsanlagen checker (Austrian Trade Act)
complianceChecker.subtitle: Work through the structured review covering facility status, permit duty, submission documents, worker protection metrics, and operational duties.

sector.question: Which business type are you planning?
sector.helper: The checker covers retail, services, hospitality/accommodation, workshops, logistics, cosmetics, data centres, and self-service concepts.

descriptions.beherbergung: Max. 30 beds, building used only for living/accommodation, no wellness facilities, breakfast or small snacks only.
descriptions.iceSalon: Pure ice-cream parlour without a full kitchen.
descriptions.otherGastro: Gastronomy concepts outside the GFVO ice-cream exemption.

isStationary.question: Is the activity tied to a fixed location?

isOnlyTemporary.question: Is it only a temporary or short-term use?

buildingUseExclusive.question: Is the building used exclusively for living/accommodation purposes?

hasWellnessFacilities.question: Are wellness or bathing facilities (pool, sauna, spa) planned?

servesFullMeals.question: Will meals beyond breakfast/snacks be served?

location.heading: Location & building compliance
location.helper: Confirm zoning, land-use designation, and existing building approvals.

zoningClarified.question: Is the zoning / land-use plan suitable for the intended use?

buildingConsentPresent.question: Is there a valid building and usage permit for the premises?

operations.heading: Operations & emissions
operations.helper: Review opening hours, emissions, hazardous materials, and technical plant.

operatingPattern.question: Which operating hours do you require?

descriptions.gfvoWindow: Standard daytime hours including the GFVO delivery window.
descriptions.extendedHours: Hours outside the exemption but not permanently round-the-clock.

hasExternalVentilation.question: Do you install outdoor ventilation, condenser, or exhaust units?

storesRegulatedHazardous.question: Do you store hazardous materials subject to special regulations (flammable liquids, gas, etc.)?

storesLabelledHazardous.question: Do you store other label-required hazardous substances in relevant quantities?

usesLoudMusic.question: Will music performances or amplified sound above background level take place?

ippcOrSevesoRelevant.question: Do IPPC/Seveso thresholds (Trade Act Annex 3, major accident rules) apply?

context.heading: Impacts & special cases
context.helper: Assess environmental impacts, infrastructure locations, and existing permits.

expectedImpairments.question: Are adverse effects under Â§ 74 (2) Trade Act expected?

locatedInInfrastructureSite.question: Is the business located within a railway, airport, port, or hospital site?

locatedInApprovedComplex.question: Is the business inside an already approved overall complex (e.g. shopping centre)?

existingPermitHistory.question: Do existing permits or suitability rulings for the site exist?

reasons.externalVentilation: Outdoor ventilation or cooling units trigger permit duty under Sec. 2 item 2 2nd GFVO.
reasons.regulatedHazardousStorage: Hazardous materials governed by special regulations exclude the exemption (Sec. 2 item 3).
reasons.labelledHazardousStorage: Label-required hazardous substances without specific storage rules remain permit-required (Sec. 2 item 4).
reasons.musicExclusion: Music performances or loud sound exclude the exemption (Sec. 2 item 5).
reasons.ippcSeveso: IPPC / Seveso relevant plants are always permit cases (Sec. 2 item 6).
reasons.noFacilityDefinition: No stationary, non-temporary facility â€“ therefore the checker stops here.
reasons.operatingHours: Planned hours exceed the 2nd GFVO window (Sec. 1 (2)).
reasons.areaExceeded: The given area exceeds the threshold of the selected exemption category.
reasons.accommodationBeds: More than 30 beds require a permit (Sec. 1 (1) item 8).
reasons.accommodationBuildingUse: The building is not used exclusively for living/accommodation â€“ exemption condition missing.
reasons.accommodationWellness: Wellness or bathing facilities are not covered by the exemption.
reasons.accommodationMeals: Serving full meals exceeds the breakfast/snack limitation of the exemption.
reasons.expectedImpairments: Â§ 74 (2) Trade Act impacts (emissions, hazards, disturbances) are expected.
reasons.individualAssessment: No clear exemption â€“ request a declaratory ruling for certainty.
reasons.freistellungSummary: All requirements of the 2nd exemption ordinance are met â€“ the facility remains permit-free as long as the conditions are respected.
reasons.title: Legal assessment

noFacility.title: No business facility under the Trade Act
noFacility.summary: The activity is mobile or only temporary and therefore outside the facility definition (Â§ 74 Trade Act).

freistellungGFVO.title: Permit-free under the 2nd GFVO
freistellungGFVO.summary: All category, time, and exclusion requirements of the 2nd exemption ordinance are fulfilled.

needsPermit.title: Permit-required facility
needsPermit.summary: Exclusion grounds or expected impacts apply â€“ a Â§ 74 Trade Act procedure is necessary.

individualAssessment.title: Individual assessment recommended
individualAssessment.summary: No clear exemption applies; the authority can issue a declaratory ruling on permit exemption.

gfvoCategories.retail: Retail up to 600 mÂ² (Sec. 1 (1) item 1 2nd GFVO)
gfvoCategories.office: Office operations without noisy machinery (Sec. 1 (1) item 2)
gfvoCategories.warehouse: Indoor warehouses up to 600 mÂ² (Sec. 1 (1) item 3)
gfvoCategories.cosmetics: Cosmetics, foot care, massage businesses (Sec. 1 (1) item 4)
gfvoCategories.tailor: Alteration tailoring / household sewing or shoe service (Sec. 1 (1) item 5)
gfvoCategories.accommodation: Accommodation â‰¤ 30 beds, no wellness, breakfast/snacks only (Sec. 1 (1) item 8)
gfvoCategories.dataCenter: Data centre without own firing plant (only emergency power engines) (Sec. 1 (1) item 11)
gfvoCategories.infrastructureSite: Facility inside approved railway, airport, port, or hospital sites (Sec. 1 (1) item 12)
gfvoCategories.embeddedFacility: Facility up to 400 mÂ² inside an already approved complex (Sec. 1 (1) item 13)

procedural.authority: The competent authority is the district authority (Vienna: MA 36 â€“ Betriebsanlagen).
procedural.projectProcedure: Permit cases require a full project submission with complete documentation.
procedural.permitEffect: Construction and operation may start only after the permit becomes legally effective.
procedural.eignungsfeststellung: Existing suitability rulings continue to act as facility-specific permits.
procedural.projectSprech: Authority project consultation days speed up expert coordination.
procedural.feeHint: Federal fees were abolished in 2017; start-ups may claim NeufÃ¶G fee relief.

general.application: Application form for establishing/modifying the facility (signed).
general.description: Operational description covering activity, hours, staffing, traffic, storage, ventilation, etc.
general.sitePlans: Site plan plus floor plans/sections (typically scale 1:100).
general.ventilationPlan: Plan or description of the ventilation/exhaust system including discharge path.
general.machineList: Machine and equipment list with ratings, media, and layout plan.
general.emissionStatement: Statement on noise, air, traffic emissions including planned mitigation.
general.wasteConcept: Waste management concept in line with Trade Act / City of Vienna guidance.
general.wasteWater: Evidence of wastewater discharge notification or permit where required.

sector.gastroExhaust: Hospitality/accommodation: kitchen exhaust proof according to state of the art (e.g. EN 16282-1).
sector.guestSanitary: Guest sanitary rooms per building code (OIB guideline 3, Austrian 'Kellner' rule).
sector.hygiene: Sector-specific hygiene documentation (food hygiene, grease separators, etc.).

labour.roomHeight: Work rooms generally require 3.0 m room height (deviations to be agreed with labour inspectorate).
labour.daylight: Natural daylight openings â‰¥ 10% of floor area; justify exceptions for basements, etc.
labour.ventilation: Natural ventilation â‰¥ 2% of floor area or mechanical systems providing 35/50/70 mÂ³/h fresh air per person (load dependent).
labour.exhaustDischarge: Discharge exhaust over the roof or sufficiently high with filtration (30â€“40 dB(A) at outlet).
labour.escapeRoutes: Escape routes: maximum 10 m to reach a route; ensure cross ventilation if depth > 10 m.
labour.escapeWidths: Escape widths by occupancy: 1â€“20 people 1.0 m | 21â€“120 people 1.2 m | add 0.1 m per extra 10 people.
labour.emergencyDoors: Emergency exit widths: up to 40 people 0.8 m, up to 80 people 0.9 m, up to 120 people 1.0 m; doors >15 people must open in escape direction.
labour.safetyLighting: Provide emergency lighting where no natural light or evening/night operation exists.
labour.staffSanitary: Staff sanitary rooms: at least one lockable cubicle per 15 persons, separate units from 5 female/male upwards, include lobby/ventilation.

operationalDuties.startAfterPermit: Operation may only begin after the permit has become final (Â§ 74 Trade Act).
operationalDuties.periodicInspection: Â§ 82b Trade Act: periodic inspection every 5 years (6 years for simplified procedure), except UMG register facilities.
operationalDuties.inspectionScope: Inspection covers compliance with permit, plans, and co-applicable regulations (Â§ 356b).
operationalDuties.inspectionCertificate: Inspection report must list facility, site, inspector competence, permits, checked regulations, and findings.
operationalDuties.deficiencyDuties: Remedy deficiencies promptly; non-compliance can trigger administrative fines (Â§ 366).

changeDuties.notifyChanges: Significant changes must be reported before implementation (Â§ 81 (3) Trade Act).
changeDuties.operationAfterNotice: Operate modified installations only after the authority's acknowledgement (within 2 months).

preCheck.contactChamber: Contact the chamber / business support service early.
preCheck.clarifyBuildingLaw: Clarify zoning, land-use and building permits before starting the project.
preCheck.engageNeighbours: Inform neighbours early to avoid conflicts.
preCheck.reviewOSH: Incorporate occupational safety requirements (AStV, OSH) in the design.
preCheck.clarifyPermitNeed: Clarify permit duty with the authority or request a declaratory ruling.
preCheck.prepareCompleteSet: Prepare a complete documentation set â€“ full submissions speed up processing.

specialNotes.selfService: Container shops/self-service outlets: check zoning and building compliance; permits may be needed depending on emissions.
specialNotes.buildingProcedure: Building and trade procedures run separately â€“ changes of use require separate building approval.
specialNotes.existingPermits: Document existing permits or suitability rulings and include them in the submission.

quickReferences.definition: Definition & five steps: WKO guide 'Weg zum genehmigten Betrieb'.
quickReferences.section82b: Regular inspection under Â§ 82b Trade Act â€“ authorised inspectors, intervals, report content.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.orientation: Note: this tool provides orientation. It checks whether your business could fall under exemptions of the 2nd exemption ordinance.
disclaimer.legal: The result is not a binding authority decision nor legal advice. MA 36 (Vienna business facility authority) issues binding rulings.
